qas.question: What was British imperial strength replace by?
When were the steamship and the telegraph invented?

answers.text: the second half of the 19th century

qas.question: What was the British Empire linked by in 1982?
How many people were added to the British Empire by 1922?
When did the British establish colonies in Australia?

context: British imperial strength was underpinned by the <a0_0>steamship and the telegraph<a0_0/>, new technologies invented in <a1_0>the second half of the 19th century<a1_0/>, allowing it to control and defend the Empire. By 1902, the British Empire was linked together by <a2_0>a network of telegraph cables<a2_0/>, the so-called All Red Line. Growing until 1922, around 13,000,000 square miles (34,000,000 km2) of territory and roughly <a3_0>458 million<a3_0/> people were added to the British Empire. The British established colonies in Australia in <a4_0>1788<a4_0/>, New Zealand in 1840 and Fiji in 1872, with much of Oceania becoming part of the British Empire.
